page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY OF RATHVEN
page.content: RATHVEN HAS THREE CHURCHES. IT HAS ONE IN THE OLD GRAVEYARD. IT WAS JUST FOR PEOPLE TO PRAY IN. THAT ONE DATES BACK TO THE 13TH CENTURY. THE MAIN CHURCH WAS BUILT IN 1794 AND THE ADDITION WAS BUILT IN 1874. ABOUT SEVEN HUNDRED YEARS AGO, THERE WAS A LEPROSY HOSPITAL IN THE FIELD NEXT TO THE GRAVEYARD. THE HOSPITAL IS NOW AN UNCULTIVATED FIELD WHERE HORSES GRAZE IN AUTUMN AND COWS IN THE SPRING AND SUMMER. THERE ARE NO VISIBLE REMAINS BUT I THINK THAT YOU COULD COME ACROSS SOMETHING IF YOU DUG DOWN. IN A DIP IN RATHVEN, THERE ARE THE RUINS OF AN OLD MILL. IT MAY DATE BACK TO THE 16TH CENTURY. THE TOWER THAT THE MILL WHEEL USED TO HANG FROM WAS KNOCKED DOWN RECENTLY BECAUSE IT WAS DANGEROUS. NEARBY, THERE IS THE MILL POND.{BY SANDY MCCONNACHIE.
